main event: A UFO sighting was reported on May 6th, 1957, about 250 miles east of 26°38' N - 23°22' W. The sighting involved a circular shape with a brilliant glow, forming a ring around it, moving at a moderate speed and disappearing behind clouds at an altitude of 9,000' on bearing of 222°.
interesting points: The UFO sighting involved a circular shape with a brilliant glow forming a ring around it, which is unusual and not commonly reported.
The sighting was documented to have occurred at a specific location, adding credibility to the report.
The report indicates that the UFO disappeared behind clouds at an altitude of 9,000', suggesting a controlled flight pattern.
The document includes a joint message form from Project Blue Book, indicating the official status and investigation of the UFO sighting.
There is mention of coordination with Navy officers and a naval repair station, underscoring the seriousness of the investigation.
location: About 250 miles east of 26°38' N - 23°22' W
witnesses: Ship officers, mates, and a radio officer as well as naval personnel
